WESTBY, WI 54667

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A male Shih Tzu named "Gordy" (tag #213) had a loose tooth on the upper left side of its mouth. The licensee had
observed this a couple days prior, but the Attending Veterinarian had not been contacted and treatment had not been
started for this dog. Dental issues can be painful and can lead to systemic disease and even death. The licensee must
contact the Attending Veterinarian and a treatment plan must be initiated for this dog. Correct by 2/2/24.

An enclosure containing three adult dogs had a chewed up wall with jagged edges. An outdoor enclosure had a gate with
a broken hinge on the bottom. The door to the enclosure was somewhat lopsided with an opening that could potentially
allow the dogs to escape. Two more enclosures containing 1 adult and 6 puppies in one and 1 adult and 3 puppies in the
other both had broken wire flooring where the feet could potentially fall through and the dogs could injure themselves.
Enclosures in disrepair could cause the dogs in those enclosures to injure themselves and could also allow for the dogs in
those enclosures to escape. The enclosures must be kept in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injury
and contain the animals securely. Correct by 2/7/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A male Shih Tzu named "Gordy" (tag #213) had a loose tooth on the upper left side of its mouth. The licensee had 
observed this a couple days prior, but the Attending Veterinarian had not been contacted and treatment had not been 
started for this dog. Dental issues can be painful and can lead to systemic disease and even death. The licensee must 
contact the Attending Veterinarian and a treatment plan must be initiated for this dog. Correct by 2/2/24. 
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
An enclosure containing three adult dogs had a chewed up wall with jagged edges. An outdoor enclosure had a gate with 
a broken hinge on the bottom. The door to the enclosure was somewhat lopsided with an opening that could potentially 
allow the dogs to escape. Two more enclosures containing 1 adult and 6 puppies in one and 1 adult and 3 puppies in the 
other both had broken wire flooring where the feet could potentially fall through and the dogs could injure themselves. 
 
Enclosures in disrepair could cause the dogs in those enclosures to injure themselves and could also allow for the dogs in 
those enclosures to escape. The enclosures must be kept in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injury 
and contain the animals securely. Correct by 2/7/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
